29 Norfolk, VA Man

  • Who are single

My self-summary
Write a little about yourself. Just a paragraph will do.
Hey new friends! My name is Zach.

I just moved to Norfolk! I'm working for an awesome environmental non-profit and trying to find my way around this new place! :-) I'm from a small town in Mississippi and have lived in the same 100 mile radius until now. I'm excited to start this new chapter of my life and am looking to meet new people and check out the town!

I'm really into organizing, activism, gender/racial/environmental/economic justice, the outdoors, and kitties. I like to play soccer! I like yoga!

I think I'm pretty funny although that doesn't always translate to others thinking I'm funny :-/ I like sarcasm, toilet humor (I love to joke about poop and bodily functions) I'm kinda judgemental, like I make fun of people I don't know sometimes; I mean not to their face of course, But you know, with close friends...
What I’m doing with my life
I'm currently and recently unemployed.NOPE!!!! NOT ANYMORE!!!! I GOT A JOB WITH AN AWESOME NON-PROFIT!!! I graduated in 2008 with a B.A. in Secondary Education and I taught high school for 2 years which was pretty cool! I enrolled in grad school full time after 2 years of teaching (it was an opportunity I couldnt pass up!) and finished my M.A. in Sociology in May of 2012.

As a grad student I got really involved in campus organizing and activism in the environmental movement, specifically around climate change. After graduation I was able to get a job starting in January of 2013 working as a campus organizer in Mississippi! It was awesome but it was a grant funded position and the money ran out last month so I'm now unemployed and on the job search!

When I worked as a campus organizer I did a lot of traveling and worked pretty long hours from home in front of a computer...I used to be really active but kinda adapted a different lifestyle over the past year...Now I'm trying to get more healthy and active (exercise, stop smoking as much, yoga, mediation, maybe start playing some soccer again).
I’m really good at
Hmmm...I used to be pretty good at soccer but haven't played in years. I'm really good at snuggling with my cats. I've got a pretty Damn good sellers rating on eBay. I'm really good at going a long time without showering! I'm a really good listener and I'm also good at trying new things (aka I like to do it!)
The first things people usually notice about me
I’m an empty essay… fill me out!
not sure...i'll ask you when we meet
Favorite books, movies, shows, music, and food
Help your potential matches find common interests.
favorite books: the last book i read was called the 4 agreements, a spiritual guide of sorts, but that was over a year ago. I'm re-reading a book called Making Societies that's a Sociology 101 reader...A lot of the reading I do is related to my when I was in grad school I read a lot of sociology related books on race, class, gender, deviance, and tons of other interesting things...when I worked as a campus organizer I read a lot of articles about movement building, a lot of really technical utility company and energy sector shit, and other stuff that I needed to be familiar with for the job. Some of my favorite books that I remember reading before grad school and work were, The Kite Runner, The Giver (when I was YOUNG), the Celestine Prophecy, Harry Potter series, Lord of the Rings series, other stuff that you probably read in high school.

favorite movies: Old Classics for me are: the princess bride, willow, star wars trilogy (IV,V,VI), A League of their Own, and Ewoks: The Battle for Endor. New Classics for me are: LOTR trilogy, the fountain, waking life, and The Matrix (only the first one)... I really like Guy Ritchie movies, Ridley Scott makes a lot of movies that I like, and I typically just browse stuff on Netflix to find something to watch.

favorite music: Currently I'm loving Sigur Ros, Jonsi, Passion Pit, Bon Iver, Yelle, M83, Hammock, and Pandora in general!

favorite food: i'll try anything and I'll usually like it
The six things I could never do without
Deserted island:
#1. My cats
#2. Some rope
#3. a multi-tool
#4. flint fire starter
#5. ipod or some music device
#6. Solar charger for ipod or music device
I spend a lot of time thinking about
What my next move is gonna be! Whether the world will change for the better or if we're gonna keep going down this unsustainable road of prosperity=growth. How can I get people to do volunteer work!

I also spend a lot of time day dreaming about random shit like what I'd need on a deserted island.
On a typical Friday night I am
Probably at my house chilling with the kitties watching netflix, cooking, or playing a video game. But it is possible that I might be out doing something even awesomer now that I live in Norfolk
The most private thing I’m willing to admit
I’m an empty essay… fill me out!
I have a trust fund worth 1.6 million dollars that I'll get when I turn 30, just two more years!!!!

Bwahahahahahahahah... just kidding
You should message me if
Offer a few tips to help matches win you over.
-we share some of the same values and interests
-we have a high match % (if you've answered a lot of questions)
-you're not religious, conservative, or just an asshole
response:
### **Scene Concept: "The Community Activist Hub"**  

#### **1. Overall Scene Theme and Core Concept**  
A bustling **community activist center** housed in a repurposed Norfolk warehouse, serving as the headquarters for a grassroots environmental nonprofit. The space is alive with collaborative energy—volunteers sorting donations, organizers planning campaigns, and artists creating protest materials. The inherent **multi-agent nature** stems from the **division of labor** (logistics, creative work, outreach) and **physical constraints** (heavy supply boxes, complex setups requiring teamwork).  

#### **2. Spatial Layout and Area Descriptions**  
The warehouse is divided into **four functional zones**, each with distinct tasks and challenges:  

1. **Main Workroom (Central Hub)** – A large open space with long tables, strewn with campaign materials, laptops, and half-finished protest signs.  
2. **Supply Storage & Donation Sorting Area** – Packed with crates of donated goods, some too heavy for one person.  
3. **Media & Design Studio** – A cluttered corner with a printer, art supplies, and a whiteboard covered in slogans.  
4. **Break Area / Lounge** – A mismatched couch, a mini-fridge, and a bulletin board covered in event flyers.  

---

## **3. Detailed Area-by-Area Inventory**  

### **A. Main Workroom (Central Hub)**  
**a. Anchor Furniture & Installations:**  
- A **12-foot folding table** (slightly wobbly, one leg taped for stability), covered in scattered papers.  
- A **wheeled corkboard** (3m x 2m) filled with activist campaign notes, pinned with multicolored pushpins.  
- **Three mismatched office chairs**—one with a broken wheel.  

**b. Key Interactive & Task-Relevant Objects:**  
- **"URGENT: PROTEST LOGISTICS" clipboard** (lists tasks needing immediate attention: "Move heavy boxes to truck," "Fix printer jam").  
- **A locked filing cabinet** (key missing, contains donor records).  
- **A half-assembled banner** (missing stencils, paint spilled nearby).  

**c. Functional Ambient Objects:**  
- **Old desktop computer** (slow, browser tabs open to fundraising pages).  
- **Wireless router** (flashing orange—needs reset).  
- **Coffee maker** (empty pot, stained filter still inside).  

**d. Background & Decorative Objects:**  
- **"STRIKE FOR CLIMATE" poster** (slightly torn, taped to wall).  
- **Cat hair on chairs** (from Zach’s feline companions).  
- **Dusty trophy** ("Best Community Organizer 2015").  

---  

### **B. Supply Storage & Donation Sorting Area**  
**a. Anchor Furniture & Installations:**  
- **Industrial shelving unit** (rusted, holds stacked donation boxes).  
- **Large rolling bin** (labeled "Textile Donations," wheels squeaky).  

**b. Key Interactive & Task-Relevant Objects:**  
- **Sealed 80lb box** ("FRAGILE: MEDICAL SUPPLIES"—requires two people to lift safely).  
- **Mismatched protest signs** (leaning against wall, some broken).  
- **"Do Not Open" mystery crate** (no label, faint rattling inside).  

**c. Functional Ambient Objects:**  
- **Barcode scanner** (low battery, beeps intermittently).  
- **Dolly cart** (one wheel loose, wobbles under weight).  

**d. Background & Decorative Objects:**  
- **Faded "VOLUNTEERS NEEDED" flyer** (from 2018).  
- **Dusty yoga mat** (rolled in corner, slightly frayed).  

---  

### **C. Media & Design Studio**  
**a. Anchor Furniture & Installations:**  
- **Large drafting table** (covered in paint splatters).  
- **Overhead projector** (dusty, bulb flickers).  

**b. Key Interactive & Task-Relevant Objects:**  
- **Jammed printer** (error light blinking, paper stuck inside).  
- **"RUSH ORDER" protest sign design** (half-printed, missing red ink).  
- **Locked USB drive** (labeled "Sensitive Donor Data").  

**c. Functional Ambient Objects:**  
- **X-Acto knife set** (one blade missing).  
- **Spray paint cans** (some nearly empty).  

**d. Background & Decorative Objects:**  
- **Cat paw prints** in dried paint.  
- **Old "Save the Bees" poster** (curling at edges).  

---  

### **D. Break Area / Lounge**  
**a. Anchor Furniture & Installations:**  
- **Secondhand couch** (one spring poking through fabric).  
- **Mini-fridge** (humming loudly, condensation dripping).  

**b. Key Interactive & Task-Relevant Objects:**  
- **"Snack Donations" box** (almost empty, last granola bar hidden under napkins).  
- **Lost keys** (on table, unclear which door they unlock).  

**c. Functional Ambient Objects:**  
- **Microwave** (door slightly ajar, interior stained).  
- **Whiteboard** ("Next Meeting: THURS 6 PM").  

**d. Background & Decorative Objects:**  
- **Mug labeled "World's Okayest Organizer."**  
- **Dead plant** (in a "Recycle Me" pot).  

---  

## **4. Scene Affordances and Embedded Potential**  

### **Collaborative Transportation Affordances**  
- **80lb "FRAGILE" medical supply box** – Too heavy for one person, requires coordinated lifting.  
- **Wobbly dolly cart** – Unreliable for heavy loads, forcing agents to strategize movement.  

### **Reasoning & Tool-Use Affordances**  
- **Attribute-Based Reasoning:** Among **five spray paint cans**, only **one has red paint left** (identified by faded label and weight difference).  
- **Compound Reasoning:** To **fix the printer**, agents must:  
  1. Find the **jammed paper** (hidden inside).  
  2. Locate **replacement ink** (stored in the supply closet).  
  3. Restart the **router** (which is glitching).  

---  

### **Final Thoughts**  
This **Community Activist Hub** is **dense with collaborative potential**—every object serves a purpose, and many tasks **require teamwork, problem-solving, and precise reasoning**. The **lived-in clutter** adds realism, while the **embedded challenges** (broken tools, missing keys, heavy objects) ensure agents must **communicate, strategize, and coordinate** to succeed.  

**Perfect for testing:**  
✅ **Multi-agent cooperation** (lifting, sorting, repairing).  
✅ **Tool-use reasoning** (fixing machines, unlocking cabinets).  
✅ **Attribute-based search** (finding specific items in clutter).  

**Would you like any refinements or expansions?**
